Description: Amuletic string: composed of many cornelian discs, barrels and short truncated convex bicone beads, some garnet discs and short barrels, one dark-blue glazed composition long truncated convex bicone bead, one amethyst spherical bead and one small amethyst shell-shaped amulet with incised striations on the convex upper face.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Thebes (historic - Upper Egypt) (said to be from)
Curator's comments: For shell-shpaed amulets, cf. W. M. F. Petrie, ‘Amulets’, London (1914), pl. XIV, 108c: 'Nerita crassilabrum' shell.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (420)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
